result: Brazil, Germany, India and Japan require the reform of the Security Council, representatives of G4 (Brazil, Germany, India and Japan) reiterated, in September 2018, their aspirations for new permanent members of a reformed council, in a joint statement. They justify their claim based on the following common feature: A) Territorial area extensivity. B) Protagonism on a regional scale. C) Investment in military technology. D) Development of nuclear energy. E) Availability of mineral resources.
